a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: The age dependency ratio is the sum of the young population (under age 15) and elderly population (age 65 and over)
relative to the working-age population (ages 15 to 64). Data are shown as the number of dependents per 100
working-age population. Projections to 2100 are based on the UN's medium population scenario.
Data source: United Nations, World Population Prospects (2022)
